newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: RUGBY LEAGUE-BRITAIN CRASH TO THIRD STRAIGHT LOSS.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY LEAGUE-BRITAIN CRASH TO THIRD STRAIGHT LOSS.

text.p: Britain crashed to a third successive loss on their rugby league tour of New Zealand when the New Zealand Maoris overwhelmed the visitors 40-28 on Tuesday.
Britain, whose best result so far is a 22-22 draw with a Lion Red XIII in their opening match, conceded seven tries and ran in five of their own.
"We did one or two pretty good things and one or two players showed they can play football," British coach Phil Larder said after the match.
"But we have committed suicide again. They scored three tries from errors we made just receiving kicks. We made too many errors on our line and they punished us."
The Maori side led 20-18 at halftime after at one stage galloping to a 20-6 advantage.
New Zealand won the opening test in the three-test series 17-12 last week. The second test is in Palmerston North on Friday.

New Zealand Maoris - David Murray, Whetu Taewa, Ricky Henry, Marlon Gardiner, Tukere Barlow, Jamie Stevens, Paul Howell, Tawera Nikau, David Pearce, Mathew Sturm, Paul Rauhihi, Sonny Whakarau, Gavin Hill. Substitutes: John Farrar, Jason Walker, Neville Ramsay, George Milner.

Britain - Steve Prescott, Jonathan Roper, Barrie-Jon Mather, Tulsen Tollett, Keith Senior, Karle Hammond, Tony Smith, Bernard Dwyer, Adrian Morley, Mick Cassidy, Brian McDermott, James Lowes, Steve Molloy. Substitutes: Nathan McAvoy, Rowland Phillips, David Bradbury, Neil Harmon.
